content.rendered:
Pupil transportation is a necessary service and integral part of the total educational program. The major objectives of the pupil transportation program are to provide safe transportation, operate an efficient and economical transportation system, adapt transportation to the requirements of the instructional program, and maintain conditions on the buses which are conducive to the best interests of students.

Student Transportation Changes

If you would like to make a change to your child’s current transportation, please fill out the Student Transportation Change Form.  Transportation requests can also be updated at any time during the school year if your needs change.

Daycare and Joint Custody Changes

Student transportation is scheduled to and from the student’s primary residence. For changes related to daycare and joint custody: View the guidelines and request form for transportation changes. 

My Ride K-12 Parent Portal / Tyler Drive / Student ID Cards

View the Traversa My Ride K-12 and Student ID Card Information

Student Behavior Expectations on School Buses

Bus behavior expectations are posted on all district school buses. View the safe bus behavior expectations. 

Reporting concerns

If you would like to notify the district about an incident or concern involving student behaviors on the school bus, first notify the bus driver. If this does not resolve the problem, you may contact your child’s school or the transportation department at (518) 587-4545.

If you would like to notify the district about an incident or concern involving a bus driver or bus assistant, contact the transportation office directly at (518) 587-4545.

If you would like to notify the district about an incident or concern involving bus routes or stops, contact the routing office at routing@saratogaschools.org or  (518) 587-4545, ext. 11315.

All other transportation-related concerns may be directed to the bus dispatcher at (518) 693-1316.

Late Bus Guidelines, Routes and Maps

View the guidelines for late bus runs, routes and maps. 

Miscellaneous Bus Information

View information on animal characters, assigned seating, electronic devices, transporting large items on buses, and dangerous substances.

Non-Public School Transportation FAQs

Transportation Requests must be submitted each school year. View the Non-Public School Transportation Frequently Asked Questions.

Top of page
